alert.note: Alert for Goshen, Middle-Lower North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 18 at 1:32PM MDT until July 18 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR STRONG WEST WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY MONDAY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST WYOMING AND THE NORTHERN NEBRASKA PANHANDLE... ...A FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY MONDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW HUMIDITIES AND GUSTY WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 433... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR LOW HUMIDITIES AND GUSTY NORTHWEST WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 433... The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. The Red Flag Warning for Monday remains in effect. For Monday... * HUMIDITY...Afternoon humidity 9 to 15 percent. * WIND...West to west-southwest winds 15 to 25 mph sustained with possible gusts to 35 to 40 mph. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated dry thunderstorms are possible Monday afternoon and early evening. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions may develop. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Goshen, Middle-Lower North Platte River Basin
